speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what are you up to?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, they put in phone jacks so you can go on-line.  I was just talking to this guy who sounds really great. [_Frasier sighs as if the idea is absurd_] What?  I'm a very busy person, how else am I going to meet people?

speaker: Frasier
text: It just seems so impersonal, Roz.  God, what ever happened to human contact?  Engaging people, face to face, eye to eye.

speaker: Roz
text: [_points out Martin at counter_] There's your dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't let him see me! [_turns away as Martin crosses to the table_]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey.

speaker: Martin
text: What you been up to?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, just surfing the net.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: [_ignoring his son_] You know, I never got into that net stuff.

speaker: Roz
text: Really?  You really ought to give it a try.  It's a great way to stay in touch with your friends and your family.

speaker: Martin
text: Family?  Gosh, you know, that's nice to know that some people still care about their family.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I gotta go.  I'm going night-fishing with Duke - and Eddie, of course!  I wouldn't leave Eddie, you don't turn your back on your family! _Martin exits the caf e. _

speaker: Roz
text: What is that all about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, our Cousin Dodie's wedding was last week.  Oh, excuse me, Cousin Dodie's "weddin'!"  A western theme.  On the response card it asked for our chili preference: mild or "kick ass!" Anyway, Niles and I told her that we had a conference to attend at the Therapist's Guild.

speaker: Roz
text: There is no Therapist's Guild, is there?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  Dad found us out.

speaker: Roz
text: Wait!  Didn't you have a Therapist Guild conference on Alice's last birthday?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_changing the subject_] The point is, it struck a nerve with Dad! [_then_] I'm sorry, Roz, it's just that he thinks we're ashamed of his family, it's been an issue with him for years, and now he hasn't spoken to me for days.  Thank God, I don't have to deal with this tonight.  I've already ear-marked a fine bottle of Chateau Beychevelle.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hot date?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles is coming over to watch "The Antiques Roadshow" with me.

speaker: Roz
text: [_mocking_] I guess you'll be coming in late, tomorrow!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's our favorite show, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Party!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, that's enough.

speaker: Roz
text: Whoo! _Roz carries on mocking Frasier as the picture FADES TO BLACK.  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. The lift doors open outside Frasier's apartment.  Niles and Frasier step off of and cross to the door.  They are carry wine and nibbles._

speaker: Frasier
text: I think the roadshow is from Harrisburg, Pennsylvania tonight.  Amish country!

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, quilts!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll cork the wine, Niles, you set up the cheese cakes. _However they are startled when Martin enters from the kitchen with some nachos and a can of beer._

speaker: Frasier/Niles
text: Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought you were going night fishing with Duke?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sakes, you can't keep this up forever, Dad. [_no response_] Well, all right, fine.  I hope you don't mind, but Niles and I are planning on watching a television show.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, really?  Well, I'm surprised you don't have a conference to go to!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, we said we were sorry about Dodie's wedding.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and we did send her a baby gift.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, Duke cancelled out on me.  You can have the TV in an hour.  I just want to watch my game show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh please, not a game show?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I happen to like it, all right?  People bring in all their junk from the attics and these experts tell them what it's worth. _The brothers realize that this summary is very similar to the show they are about to watch._

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you talking about "The Antiques Roadshow?"

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's the program Niles and I are going to watch!

speaker: Niles
text: I'll just check outside and see if the world has ended. _Niles enters the kitchen to set up the cheese cakes as Frasier heads to the couch opening the wine._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if you want to watch it, no one's stopping you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, wonderful. [_laughs_]

speaker: Presenter
text: [_v.o._] And you have no idea what this writing desk might be worth?

speaker: Woman
text: [_v.o._] No, my husband bought it at a garage sale.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's a lovely piece.  I'd say it's Sheridan.

speaker: Presenter
text: At auction, this would bring in more than eight thousand dollars.

speaker: Martin
text: Whoa-ho-ho!  Ca-ching!

speaker: Woman
text: What about this chair?  Is it an original too?

speaker: Niles
text: It certainly looks it.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, no, they always do this.  Set 'em up on the first one and then lower the boom on the second one.

speaker: Niles
text: I think that carving looks authentic.

speaker: Frasier
text: So does the inlay.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, no!

speaker: Presenter
text: I'm sorry to say this chair is a reproduction, worth at best one hundred and fifty dollars.

speaker: Woman
text: Oh, what a shame.

speaker: Martin
text: Keep watching, boys.  You'll get the hang of it. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment -- Later. The three Crane men are getting very friendly at last.  Niles is sat on the floor with a wine glass in his hand.  Frasier's sat on the coffee table with a wine glass.  Martin is in his chair with a can of beer.  "The Antiques Roadshow" is still running. _

speaker: Presenter
text: [_v.o._] But the real clue here is the veneer. _The Crane men, playing their drinking game, all shout out "veneer!" and take a swig of their drinks._

speaker: Presenter
text: And now for some background information on the beautiful city of Harrisburg.

speaker: Martin
text: Mute! _Frasier and Niles laugh as Martin turns the sound off.   Daphne enters with a green box._

speaker: Daphne
text: Evening, all. [_they greet her_] Wow!  I don't see the three of you watching the same show very often.  What's going on? Pavarotti jumping the Grand Canyon?

speaker: Martin
text: It's "The Antiques Roadshow."  What you got in the box?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's Donny's mother's wedding gown.  He wants me to wear it at the wedding.  What if I don't like it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, if you want to try it on, we'll be glad to have a look.

speaker: Martin
text: Just go put it on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad, turn it up. [_he does_]

speaker: Sara Briggs
text: But the real masterwork is the unique art deco headboard. It features a variety of veneers.

speaker: Sara Briggs
text: Mahogany veneer...

speaker: Sara Briggs
text: Burled walnut veneer...

speaker: Sara Briggs
text: And zebra wood veneer.

speaker: Sara Briggs
text: And now back to our...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_recovering_] Oh God... next week we gotta pick a different word.  Need another bottle of wine, Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, me too, I love these educational shows. _Frasier enters the kitchen with the old bottle of wine as Niles also brings in Martin's old beer cans.  Frasier gets a new bottle as Niles gets another beer from the fridge for his father._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I can't get over Dad.  It seems this little rift between us has been mended.

speaker: Niles
text: Can you believe he used the word "craftsman," and he meant the architectural style, and not the rotary sander?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, that's uncanny.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you heard him.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not that, you just said "rotary sander."

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, did we miss anything?

speaker: Martin
text: Nah, just some bozo with a credenza who doesn't know a Biedermeier from an Oscar Meyer.

speaker: Presenter
text: That's it for this week.  See you next time on "The Antiques Roadshow."  Next Saturday the roadshow will be here in Seattle.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!

speaker: Presenter
text: Viewers can bring their treasures to the convention center for a free appraisal.

speaker: Martin
text: We oughta go, that'd be great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well sure, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: That does sound like fun.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I'm going to go and have a little root around in our closet.  I bet I can find a nice little [_correct pronunciation_] _objet d'art_ they'd be interested in.

speaker: Niles
text: It's as if that panhandler I gave money to was a genie granting all my wishes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Would you marry me in this? _We see that Daphne has entered.  She is wearing the "wedding gown." It consists of white go-go boots, a fluffy white veil and very little else.  In fact, just a white miniskirt connected to a tight white bra by flimsy suspenders.  Niles nearly faints._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispers_] How much did you give him?

speaker: Niles
text: It's attractive, Daphne.  It's a bit unorthodox.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah.  That's what I think.

speaker: Daphne
text: Donny, I've just put your mum's wedding dress on.  A mini- skirt?  It's obscene!  You can see my... What?  No, I took the green box. [_laughs_] No problem, then.  Bye. [_hangs up_] I took the wrong dress.  This is from his mother's third marriage in 1968 in Las Vegas. _Daphne starts laughing along with Niles.  Daphne bends down trying to control her laughter.  Niles peers over her and down her bra without her noticing._

speaker: Daphne
text: Can you believe people used to actually dress like this?

speaker: Niles
text: I wish I had a picture of it for whenever I needed a laugh. [_tries to follow her to her bedroom_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles! _Niles walks back sighing in fantasy.  FADE TO:_ **A TSAR IS BORN** _Scene Four - The Antiques Roadshow. Martin and Frasier are hanging around the set.  Martin is holding a rather ugly pewter clock consisting of a small round dial set in the middle of a hideous bear._

speaker: Martin
text: This bear clock's been in the family for generations, I can't wait to see how much it's worth.  Do you think they'll put a dollar figure on it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sounds about right.

speaker: Martin
text: Very funny, but you know, your grandpa passed this down to me and someday, when I'm gone, it'll be passed on to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, I don't even want to think about that day.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, I've got to see if I can go and get this baby appraised.

speaker: Niles
text: I am so sorry, but on the way in I had the most amazing celebrity sighting: Hans Dietrich.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_thrilled_] The loveseat expert?

speaker: Niles
text: The very same.  He's much smaller in person than on television. He's that big. [_holds a hand up to the bottom of his neck_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Get out!

speaker: Martin
text: Boys, come over here, they want to put me and the clock on TV.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord, we can't appear on TV with that hideous thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Everyone we know watches this program.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank God he didn't bring along that dreadful mounted jackrabbit's head with the antelope horns.

speaker: Niles
text: The Jackalope!  Texas's answer to the Minotaur.

speaker: Martin
text: So what do you think of that, boys?  They said they've never seen anything like it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you know, this could go either way.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I know.  I'm not going to act like one of those saps I make fun of.  Doesn't matter if it's worth two dollars or two thousand, I'm just gonna say, "That's pretty much what I figured." _The director shouts that tape is rolling so Niles and Frasier back off out of view from the camera.  The bear clock is on a table in front of the camera.  Martin and the appraiser are standing around the table._

speaker: Martin
text: [_calls to boys_] Guys, which one of you wants to come and hold this?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Dad.  We wouldn't dream of it.

speaker: Niles
text: This is your moment.

speaker: Director
text: Everybody ready?  Action.

speaker: Appraiser
text: So, Martin, what can you tell us about this pewter clock?

speaker: Martin
text: [_playing to the camera_] Well, it is a clock set in the stomach of what appears to be a bear.

speaker: Appraiser
text: Actually, it's much more than that.  It's Russian, made in the mid-nineteenth century.

speaker: Martin
text: That's pretty much what I figured.

speaker: Appraiser
text: Actually, it's a stunning piece.  It was made by Andre Krogyn, who worked for Tsar Alexander II.

speaker: Martin
text: That is pretty much what I figured.

speaker: Appraiser
text: I don't know if you're descended from the Romanovs, Martin, but all of Krogyn's known bear clocks were done exclusively for the Romanov family and are now in the Hermitage Museum. _By now, Niles and Frasier, baffled by the findings, have walked into camera view and are standing alongside Martin._

speaker: Appraiser
text: Martin, you may be surprised to learn that this clock at auction would easily bring $25,000.

speaker: Martin
text: [_excited_] Ca-ching! _He laughs and claps his hands excitedly, but Frasier and Niles calm him into acting reserved again._

speaker: Frasier
text: What he means is, that's pretty much what we figured. _Frasier reaches out and strokes the bear clock like a favorite possession while he and Niles smile into the camera.  End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Martin, Niles and Frasier enter the apartment with the bear clock in hand._

speaker: Frasier
text: After you, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, you know, Dad?  I've been thinking, we should find an appropriate place for this clock.  How about right here on this console? [_puts it on table behind sofa_]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I get it!  It doesn't look quite so bad to you guys now that it's worth twenty-five grand.  Oh, I could kick myself for not bringing that Jackalope! _Martin exits to the kitchen as Niles and Frasier give a look at each other._

speaker: Niles
text: What an amazing day, eh?

speaker: Frasier
text: It certainly was.  You know, Niles, I was meaning to ask you about something.  Remember the appraiser said something about the bear being from Russia, dad being part of the Romanov family?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, yeah, you know, that struck my ear too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, although I don't seriously believe there's any real chance of that.

speaker: Niles
text: [_half-heartedly_] No, of course not.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_dragging it out_] It's a long shot.

speaker: Niles
text: It's possible.

speaker: Frasier
text: Although we do have the bear.

speaker: Niles
text: I know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad.  Niles just reminded me of something I completely forgot.  When the appraiser mentioned that the bear was from Russia...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah.  Well, it probably got passed down through your great-great grandmother.  She was from Russia.

speaker: Frasier
text: A-ha, he said something about the Romanov family?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, that, eh?  Are you sure you want to hear about this?

speaker: Niles
text: [_no question_] Yes, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess you would have found out anyway after I died... We're royalty.

speaker: Martin
text: But I didn't want you to grow up spoiled, so I abdicated and took a job in Seattle on the police force. [_the brothers realize his joke_] It was kinda hard giving up that royal way of life, but I think maybe it's the swans that I miss most.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very funny, Dad.  Point taken.  Sherry, Niles? [_crosses to sherry_]

speaker: Niles
text: Please.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sorry to disappoint you.  I know you'd rather be anything else in the world except Cranes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  Now that is just not true, we are proud to be Cranes. It's just innocent curiosity.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I gotta go call Duke.  But don't get excited, he's not a real Duke. _Martin exits to his room as Frasier brings the sherries across to Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we stepped in it that time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, what the hell is wrong with us?  Asking whether we are related to the Romanovs.  We just got past this whole Crane shame thing.

speaker: Niles
text: We should have known it'd just upset him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and for what?  Trying to find some distant connection to royalty.

speaker: Niles
text: Even if we can prove it, what do we have?

speaker: Frasier
text: Huh, a story to tell at parties.

speaker: Niles
text: An occasional seat at a state dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Some meaningless title.  It's insane.

speaker: Niles
text: Ridiculous... destructive.

speaker: Frasier
text: Still, there is this grandmother.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm right behind you.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, given our new pride in the Crane name, perhaps it would behoove us to research our family tree.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, in a way we'd be honoring Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course we wouldn't need to tell him.

speaker: Niles
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just a few hours on the internet, a trip to the library, we could sketch in the entire family tree.

speaker: Niles
text: And if there should happen to be a connection [_breathless with glee_] to the Romanovs...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what harm is there in that?  [_N.B. Famous last words._]

speaker: Frasier
text: It is amusing to contemplate, isn't it, Niles?  You, me, Dad - all part of an ancient noble family. _Martin then bursts out his room holding the jackalope to his forehead and chasing Eddie into the kitchen, showing off the true noble spirit of the Crane family._

speaker: Martin
text: Okay Eddie, the jackalope's gonna get ya!  The jackalope is gonna get ya! _FADE TO:  Scene Two - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier is surfing the internet and tracing his family tree at the window seat as Roz enters wearing a red dress with a silk shawl. _

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.  How's the research going?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, sit down, Roz.  I'll bring you up to speed.

speaker: Roz
text: No, thank you. [_sits on another table_] I'm meeting someone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good God!  Not one of your internet dalliances?

speaker: Roz
text: It's just coffee, okay?  Listen, this guy's totally legit, he e-mailed me his picture. [_holds it up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: A picture?  Oh, for God's sakes, Roz, what can you learn from a picture?  The man's probably a lunatic, a psychopath... [_looks at picture_] Oh, he's a pretty boy.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait... I know this photo.  It's the cover of this month's Bidwell's catalogue!

speaker: Roz
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm positive, I ordered those socks and driving shoes!

speaker: Roz
text: How could someone do this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's probably some insecure would-be Romeo trying to lure you into a meeting.

speaker: Noel
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel.

speaker: Noel
text: [_to Roz_] What have we here?  An empty seat next to yours. May I?

speaker: Roz
text: No!  Of all the dumbass things you've done to get me to go out with you, e-mailing me this picture is just the most moronic!

speaker: Noel
text: But, Roz-!

speaker: Roz
text: Forget it, buddy! _The man in Roz's photo enters Nervosa and watches the scene, as Roz backs Noel into the counter, hitting him with the picture._

speaker: Roz
text: I ought to take your mouse cord and wrap it around your nerdy little neck until your eyes pop out like champagne corks!

speaker: Noel
text: [_looks at picture_] But I didn't send you this.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah right, then who did?

speaker: Noel
text: My guess would be... [_points to man_] that guy.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God!  Oh, Noel, I'm so sorry. [_gathers her things_]

speaker: Noel
text: How sorry?

speaker: Roz
text: Not that sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: I just saw the Bidwell's guy!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes. [_Niles sits_] Well Niles, how goes the research?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I think you're going to be very pleased.  According to this catalogue of Russian antiquities, the bear clock was last seen in Moscow in 1879.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, hold on to your fur hat, Niles.  I just discovered that our great-great grandmother emigrated from Russia... 1879!

speaker: Niles
text: My God, it's all coming together.  I can practically picture the scene.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Our great-great grandmother, smelling revolution in the wind...

speaker: Frasier
text: Secretly slips away in the black Russian night...

speaker: Niles
text: Taking the bear clock with her to remind her of better days.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  The ticking hands of time counting down her return, her royal power merely hibernating. [_Frasier's mobile sounds, he answers_] Yes?  Yes, yes, I'll hold.

speaker: Niles
text: Who is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's Dr. Myshkin.  He's an attache at the Russian embassy, also an expert on the Romanovs. [_to phone_] Yes, Dr. Myshkin. This evening would be fine.  About seven � clock.  Yes, I live in the Elliot Bay Towers.  I'll see you then. [_hangs up_] He has some important information for us.  My God, Niles, this is it.  The final link to our royal past.  I'm going to issue a press release!

speaker: Niles
text: Not before I shout it from the rooftops! [_notices Martin entering_] Here's Dad, hide everything! _They quickly clean things off the table and shut the laptop as Martin enters._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey guys, I thought I'd find you here.  You know, you just missed seeing yourselves on "The Antiques Roadshow." [_They fake noises of disappointment_] And you know, the phone's been ringing off the hook, everybody wants to buy that bear clock.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're not thinking of selling it, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: You're damn right I am!  Some guy just offered me twenty-six thousand for it.  I'm gonna buy me a big, honking fishing boat, with a Wave Pounder 450 and a fun deck.  Good for fishin', crusin', or just plain tubin'! [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: Did you hear that Frasier?  We can go tubin'. [_Mouths to Frasier "Do Something!"_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, perhaps Niles and I could sell the clock for you.  I mean, we do know the antiques world and you know, we could get you more than twenty-six thousand.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!

speaker: Niles
text: I should think at least thirty thousand.

speaker: Martin
text: Huh.  You know, maybe I will let you boys handle this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wise move, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, we'd hate to see you get manipulated. _Martin leaves the cafe as Frasier and Niles exchange congratulatory grins.  FADE TO:_ **MYSHKIN ACCOMPLISHED** _Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. The doorbell sounds.  Niles and Frasier answer it to Dr. Myshkin._

speaker: Myshkin
text: Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dr. Myshkin, please.  Come in.  This is my brother, Dr. Niles Crane. _Niles clicks his heels and bobs his head in his version of a communist salute._

speaker: Myshkin
text: [_spots clock_] Oh, there it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, have a look. [_he does_] Is it authentic?

speaker: Myshkin
text: Without a doubt. [_Frasier gasps_]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: I know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, you know, there is some caviar on the ice in the kitchen.  Now would be the appropriate time, if you would, please?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sarcastic_] Oh, I am so sorry.  Here I am, dawdling with the laundry when it's ten minutes into caviar time!

speaker: Myshkin
text: As I mentioned, I have some information which should be very interesting to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, please make yourself comfortable. Do tell, tell.

speaker: Myshkin
text: [_holds up a book_] This is a copy of the diary of Princess Sonia Romanov, daughter to Tsar Alexander II.  At eighteen she fell in love with a commoner, an American. [_Niles mouths "Our grandmother" to Frasier_] Their union, of course, was forbidden, but Sonia decided to give everything up for love.

speaker: Frasier
text: _Quel elegance._

speaker: Myshkin
text: She enlisted the aid of a scullery maid, who smuggled money, clothing and this bear clock out of the palace.

speaker: Niles
text: [_thrilled_] She would elope to America!

speaker: Myshkin
text: Yes, that was her plan, but when Sonia found her way to the train station under the cover of night, the scullery maid absconded with everything, including the clock.

speaker: Niles
text: Servants!

speaker: Frasier
text: There's a back aching for the lash! _The camera then cuts to Daphne who has already entered the room with the caviar.  She gets the wrong end of the stick._

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm moving as fast as I can! [_slams caviar down and exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, tell us.  How did we get our clock back?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, tell us, how did Great-Great-Grandmamma retrieve it?

speaker: Myshkin
text: [_confused for a moment, then_] Uh, Drs. Crane... your ancestor is not the princess, your ancestor is the scullery maid. _Silence as Frasier and Niles absorb this bombshell.  Then Myshkin stands and picks up the clock._

speaker: Myshkin
text: Well, on behalf of the Russian people, I thank you for retrieving this for us.

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean, you're just going to take it?!

speaker: Myshkin
text: Well, its rightful place is in the Hermitage Museum.

speaker: Niles
text: But this clock has been in our family for generations...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles. [_Frasier motions him to cover the front door, he does_]

speaker: Myshkin
text: Dr. Crane, we could settle this in the courts, but you wouldn't win.  Do you really want this to come out in the press?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, do you really expect us just to let you walk out of here with a precious family heirloom?!

speaker: Myshkin
text: Did I mention that your ancestor, before she married a Noah Crane in 1882, worked as a prostitute in New York?

speaker: Frasier
text: Enjoy your bear. _Niles steps aside letting Myshkin out.  As the door is opened we find Martin just entering._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hello.

speaker: Myshkin
text: Dr. Profiry Myshkin.

speaker: Martin
text: [_shaking hands_] Marty Crane.  I see you've got the clock.

speaker: Myshkin
text: That's right.  Good evening, all.

speaker: Martin
text: Bye.

speaker: Martin
text: You sold it!  I hope you got a good price.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gee, Dad, I hope you didn't buy a boat.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I was thinking about it and then I thought, oh hell. We've been getting along so well... [_to Frasier_] And you don't like fishing. [_to Niles_] And you get seasick.  Why not get something we can all enjoy, you know?

speaker: Martin
text: So I bought this! [_holds up a picture of an RV to the boys_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_covering with mock excitement_] A Winnebago!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah!

speaker: Frasier
text: A big one!

speaker: Martin
text: Thirty-three footer, with air suspension and power jacks. Thirty thousand used, but you got that much for the clock, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course. [_Niles looks at him sharply_]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's great.  We can go anywhere.  You know, the first place I want to go is Elmo, Nebraska.  We got a whole mess of cousins down there! [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... we're out fifteen thousand each.

speaker: Niles
text: And we have to take long trips in a Winnebago.

speaker: Frasier
text: And we're not Romanovs.  We're descended from thieves and whores.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, I remember reading that Henry James once had a liaison with a Russian prostitute in New York.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm right behind you. _They clink glasses once again.  End of Act Two._
